title: Houthis Fired Drones, Missiles in Abu Dhabi Attack, Investigation Finds
summary: The attack showed off the military advances that the Iran-backed Yemeni militia has made in recent years. Iran-backed Houthi militants in Yemen used advanced missiles and drones to target the United Arab Emirates on Monday, according to people briefed on the investigation-a deadly demonstration of the expanding threat to Middle East security posed by Tehran's emboldened allies.

title: The Election 'Subversion' Hunt
summary: GOP legislatures aren't moving to overrule their state's popular vote.. President Biden's Georgia speech last week on voting and elections was riddled with too many falsehoods to count. But one of his claims deserves closer scrutiny. The President said the "endgame" of Republican state legislatures is "to turn the will of the voters into a mere suggestion-something states can respect or ignore." Assuring listeners that this is "not hyperbole," he added, "your vote won't matter. They'll just decide what they want and then do it."

title: O'Rourke, Abbott Raise Millions in Texas Governor Race
summary: Candidates in other competitive states including New York release information on early fundraising hauls. Gubernatorial candidates in Texas and New York reported big fundraising hauls Tuesday, signaling the start to an expensive election year across many U.S. states.

title: How to Mess Up a 5G Rollout
summary: We're from the FAA and we're here to blame you for our mistakes.. It's hard to know which is more messed up these days-air transportation, or the Biden Administration. As another case in point, consider the clash between airlines and wireless carriers over 5G.

title: LA's Railroad Robber Barons
summary: Jesse James was born in the wrong century. Today robbing trains is easy.. Wonder what happened to the gift you sent that your sister never received, or the Covid at-home tests you ordered that were never delivered? Maybe they were pillaged by the bandits that rule Los Angeles.

title: Another Escalation in Yemen
summary: Biden tried to end the war with diplomacy. More violence followed.. Something keeps happening in President Biden's foreign policy: The White House announces that it wants to emphasize diplomacy on a particular issue, and American adversaries respond by advancing their interests with force. Consider the Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen.

title: Microsoft's Activision Buy Highlights Push Toward Mobile, Metaverse
summary: Shares of Electronic Arts, Ubisoft jumped as investors place bets on rapidly consolidating videogame industry. Microsoft Corp.'s $75 billion deal to buy Activision Blizzard Inc. reflects two trends driving consolidation in the videogame industry: the push to mobile and building for the metaverse.

title: Former Digital Editor Files Discrimination Suit Against New York Post
summary: Michelle Gotthelf alleges that former editor Col Allan propositioned her for sex and created a hostile work environment. A former high-ranking New York Post editor filed a discrimination lawsuit against the publication, alleging she was sexually harassed by former Editor in Chief Col Allan and fired after she told the Post's current editor in chief about it.

title: Boardroom Lessons for Biden and Congress
summary: Corporate America has faced governance problems similar to those in the capital.. If America were a corporation, investors and regulators would consider its corporate governance a mess. CEO Joe Biden can't seem to agree with the board-Congress-on strategy, priorities, the budget, or pretty much anything else. Some directors are going rogue, ignoring board meetings and the normal chain of command.

title: Putin Is Waging War on Europe
summary: His officials and media supporters have started talking openly about 'military confrontation.'. Paris

title: Jackie Gleason's Insurance in a Trunk
summary: When the star hit it big, he prepared for a reversal of fortune.. Millions of people dream of making their lives immeasurably better, richer, happier. And what if it comes true? What if you hit the jackpot? The most thought-provoking piece of advice I've ever heard on this point came from an unexpected source: Jackie Gleason, the television and movie star, who died in 1987.

title: 'Worn' Review: Material World
summary: The story of ﬁve fabrics-linen, cotton, silk, synthetics and wool-and their impact on civilization, politics and the environment.. Sofi Thanhauser gets her best clothes from a place called the Dumptique. This isn't an expensive shop on Madison Avenue but a tiny shack in a field near a municipal landfill on Martha's Vineyard, where she grew up. Here,next to pots, pans, books and worn-out puzzles, designer clothes discarded by rich summer residents are piled in bins, free for the taking. These, of course, are better made and more durable than the ones she calls "fast fashion." After wearing them, she notices how poorly made most new garments are.

title: Progressives vs. the Metaverse
summary: Today's left is invested in an identity politics that virtual reality will make obsolete.. How will the metaverse go over with progressives? Not so good from early signs.

title: The Racial Progress Democrats Won't Admit
summary: Biden makes an ugly appeal to fear as black voter-registration and turnout keep climbing.. President Biden has spent the better part of his first year in office insisting he wants to steer the country in a less racially divisive direction. Last week he took it all back. When you invoke Bull Connor, Jefferson Davis, George Wallace and the Ku Klux Klan to describe your political opponents, your objective isn't racial harmony but something closer to the opposite. Maybe we should thank him for finally coming clean.

title: Should Biden Continue Deferring Student Loan Repayments?
summary: Students discuss proposals for canceling college debt.. Editor's note: In this Future View, students discuss if President Biden should defer student debt. Next week we'll ask, "Which is a greater threat to Jews in America: anti-Semitism of the left, or anti-Semitism of the right?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Jan. 25. The best responses will be published that night.

title: With Rate Increases Looming, Investors Dump Shares of Money-Losing Companies
summary: The valuation calculus is changing on companies that don't turn profits. Moonshot stocks are coming back to Earth.

title: U.K. Audit Regulator Expects to Pursue More Enforcement Cases
summary: The Financial Reporting Council sees its budget and staff increasing leading up to the formation of the Audit, Reporting and Governance Authority. The U.K. audit regulator said it expects to pursue more enforcement cases and increase its budget as it looks to tackle new responsibilities and fold into a new regulatory body.

title: Wells Fargo Names Derek Flowers Its Chief Risk Officer
summary: Mr. Flowers, a 24-year veteran at the bank and previously its head of strategic execution and operations, replaces Amanda Norton in the role. Wells Fargo & Co. has appointed Derek Flowers as the bank's next chief risk officer.

title: Microsoft to Buy Activision Blizzard
summary: Activision CEO Bobby Kotick is expected to leave the videogame heavyweight that has been roiled by claims of workplace misconduct. Microsoft Corp. agreed to buy Activision Blizzard Inc. in an all-cash deal valued at about $75 billion, using its largest acquisition by far to grab a videogame heavyweight that has been roiled by claims of workplace misconduct.

title: Suspect in Anne Frank's Betrayal to Nazis Identified
summary: Cold-case investigation led by former FBI agent zeroes in on a prominent Jewish businessman as a likely culprit, a new book says. A recent cold-case investigation might have uncovered who betrayed Anne Frank's family and turned them over to the Nazis, according to a new book.

title: Ted Cruz vs. Frankenstein's Monster
summary: The Supreme Court takes up another case about restrictions on political speech.. When the Supreme Court upheld the constitutionality of major portions of the Federal Election Campaign Act in Buckley v. Valeo (1976), it launched what is now a nearly half-century experiment with heavy regulation of political speech and campaign financing.

title: Supreme Court Skeptical of Boston's Exclusion of Christian Flag
summary: Justices hear arguments on city's refusal to let symbol of Christianity fly in front of City Hall, where various other flags have been featured. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court appeared doubtful of Boston's refusal to fly a flag symbolizing Christianity before City Hall after dozens of other third-party flags ran on the pole, with several justices suggesting that local officials read too strictly the constitutional rule against establishment of religion.

title: Biden Administration Starts Taking Orders for Free Covid-19 Tests
summary: Website opens in pilot phase a day ahead of its planned debut. The Biden administration began taking orders for free Covid-19 tests on Tuesday, a day ahead of the planned launch of its website for ordering and distributing rapid Covid-19 tests to Americans.

title: Oil Prices Hit Seven-Year High on Rising Geopolitical Tensions
summary: Ebbing concerns over the Omicron variant and tensions in Europe and the Middle East are helping to drive the rally. Crude prices rose to their highest level since the 2014 shale-induced oil crash, a milestone in a rally that is gathering momentum as geopolitical tensions threaten to knock supply.

title: Stocks End Lower as Bond Yields Hit Two-Year High
summary: Tech stocks slide, but Activision Blizzard shares rocket after Microsoft deal news. U.S. stock indexes fell Tuesday and bond yields hit two-year highs as investors fretted over whether the Federal Reserve will raise interest rates more quickly and aggressively than expected.

title: Goldman Pays Up for Talent, Sending Profits Down
summary: Wall Street giant's compensation expenses soared 33% in 2021. The bill has come due for Wall Street's deal-making spree, and it is being sent by human resources.

title: Peloton Bikes, Treadmills Set to Cost More
summary: Fitness company said it is adding hundreds of dollars in setup and delivery charges to list prices for some of its exercise equipment. The prices people pay for some Peloton Interactive Inc . products are about to increase.

title: U.S. Aims Sanctions at Pro-Russian Agents as Blinken Plans Ukraine, Russia Meetings
summary: Pending sanctions, which will freeze the assets of at least four individuals, could be announced as early as Thursday. The U.S. is preparing financial sanctions on pro-Russian agents in Ukraine as Secretary of State Antony Blinken heads to Europe to meet the Ukrainian leadership and his Russian counterpart, part of a show of diplomacy and pressure that Washington hopes will dissuade Russia from invading its neighbor, U.S. officials said.

title: 'La Fortuna' Review: Tucci Tussles Over Treasure
summary: Stanley Tucci stars in this based-on-a-true-story tale about the legal battles over a sunken treasure. The fact-based adventure "La Fortuna" begins with treasure being found: the remains, and priceless cargo, of a 19th-century Spanish galleon sunk by the British near Gibraltar in 1804. In its simplest terms, this six-part legal thriller is a question of finders-keepers: Who's going to weep? The party that paid to recover the gold? Or the country that left it at the bottom of the ocean for more than 200 years?

title: 'Hell on Church Street' by the Punch Brothers Review: Spunky Reverence
summary: One generation's bluegrass innovators salute their hero-guitar master Tony Rice.

title: Netflix Gives Its Toughest Audience What It Wants
summary: Price increases come as stock slumps on subscriber-growth worries ahead of fourth-quarter results. In a way, Netflix might soon find out just how critic-proof it really is.

title: BJ's Wholesale Club to Move Credit Cards to Capital One, a Blow to ADS
summary: Warehouse club sued ADS Tuesday, saying the card issuer isn't moving fast enough to transfer accounts. Alliance Data Systems Corp. is losing one of its biggest credit-card accounts: BJ's Wholesale Club Holdings Inc.

title: Find Covid-19 Home Tests Using Online Product Trackers
summary: You don't have to run all over town hunting for self-test kits. Just keep your phone handy and be ready to buy when the shopping bot says they are in stock.. You don't have to run all over town hunting for self-test kits. Just be ready to buy when the bot says they are in stock.

title: Ooh! (Wednesday Crossword, January 19)
Omicron's Impact on Oil Demand Weaker Than Expected in Late 2021
summary: Uncertainties remain over new variants of the virus and renewed mobility restrictions, cartel says. Demand for oil was stronger than expected in the final three months of 2021, as rising Covid-19 cases failed to diminish global appetite for crude or result in significant mobility restrictions, the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries said Tuesday.

title: Exxon Pledges to Reduce Carbon Emissions From Operations to 'Net Zero'
summary: Oil giant said it would zero out emissions from assets it operates by 2050, but didn't commit to reducing emissions from use of its fuels. Exxon Mobil Corp. said it has set a goal to reduce or offset greenhouse-gas emissions from its operations to zero by 2050, as investor and public pressure mounts on oil producers to respond to climate change.

title: YouTube Shuts Division for Original Programming
summary: Unit launched 'Cobra Kai,' but most shows never gained traction with viewers. Google's YouTube is folding its effort to create original programming and focusing on the millions of creators who populate the video platform with content.

title: Microsoft-Activision Deal Likely to Face Close Antitrust Scrutiny
summary: Companies will have to navigate harder line from enforcers in U.S., abroad on tech deals. Microsoft Corp.'s proposed $75 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard Inc. is likely to receive a close look from antitrust enforcers in the U.S. and abroad at a time when they have stepped up scrutiny of proposed mergers, especially in the tech sector.

title: After Volcano Eruption, Tonga Needs to Bring In Aid but Keep Out Covid-19
summary: Governments, humanitarian groups ready relief effort while seeking to ensure Tonga remains free of virus. WELLINGTON, New Zealand-In the aftermath of a volcanic eruption and tsunami that ravaged parts of Tonga, governments and humanitarian agencies are wrestling with how to get aid safely into one of the last Covid-free places on Earth.

title: New York Magazine Union, Management Reach Deal That Will Boost Wages for Staff
summary: Union says deal includes a $60,000 salary floor, layoff protections and guaranteed annual pay increases. The New York Magazine Union has reached a deal for its first contract, after more than two years of negotiations, and the union says the framework includes salary increases for more than half of staffers and guaranteed yearly increases in pay.

title: Pfizer's New Covid-19 Pill Works Against Omicron in Lab
summary: Three separate, unpublished lab studies indicate Paxlovid is effective against the variant despite its mutations. Pfizer Inc.'s new Covid-19 pill, Paxlovid, was effective against the Omicron variant in laboratory tests, an encouraging early sign the drug will be an important tool while the strain spreads.

title: Climate Change and a Question of Priorities
summary: Limiting emissions will require immense progress.. Regarding Andy Kessler's "Is Climate Change in Your Top 10?" (Inside View, Jan. 10): My top-10 list of concerns contains only three fundamental items. First, the economic illiteracy of many government leaders. This gives us policies with perverse incentives (paying people not to work during a labor shortage, killing energy production as prices soar), as well as staggering national debt, bloated government and increasing inflation.

title: Georgia's Voting-Law Overreach
summary: Karl Rove conflates offering food and drink with 'electioneering.'. I read Karl Rove regularly because he is an astute observer of the political scene. But I'm surprised that in "Biden's Georgia Election-Law Distortions" (op-ed, Jan. 13) he conflates offering food and drink to voters standing in sometimes long lines in untoward weather with "electioneering." In several national elections, I have volunteered to offer water and snacks to voters in long lines, which the Georgia law now forbids. We were always warned not to solicit votes or ask who the voter will support or to wear clothing supporting particular candidates. To conflate this with "electioneering" is misrepresenting what usually happens on the ground level.

title: When the Listing Is Underwater, Literally
summary: Agents tell about having to close a deal when the weather gods won't cooperate. Poppy Troupe Premier associate, Coldwell Banker Realty, Norwell, Mass.

title: Crypto.com Halts Withdrawals After Suspicious Account Activity
summary: CEO says no user funds were lost; company to offer full report after investigation is completed. The online platform crypto.com suspended customer withdrawals for about 14 hours on Monday, after reports of unauthorized activity in the accounts of some users, the company said.

title: Palo Alto Schools Stay Open Thanks to Parent Volunteers
summary: Resume Subscription. PALO ALTO, Calif.-Fang Xue, a software engineer at Google, took an hour off from work Wednesday to wipe down outdoor lunch tables at a middle school here.

title: Goldman's Long-Term Shift Remains Key
summary: Gains on Wall Street trading desks may be slowing, but Goldman Sachs is still placing bets on a steadier future. Wall Street trading may not be quite the bonanza it was in 2021, but investors don't have to cash in their bets quite yet.

title: The Not-So-Hidden Strategy Behind the Green Energy Transition
summary: Raise the cost of fossil fuels high enough to justify the high cost of green energy.. The last sentence of Bjorn Lomborg's op-ed "Today's Soaring Energy Prices Are Only the Beginning" (Jan. 6) reads: "Only when green energy is cheaper than fossil fuel-or at least close to cheaper-will voters be willing to switch." For a year or so I agreed and have kept watching for the cost of green energy to decrease while expecting the cost of fossil-fuel energy to remain roughly the same. But when I saw Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm laugh wholeheartedly when asked what she would do about the rising cost of gasoline, I realized my mistake. The Biden administration's strategy is to raise the cost of fossil fuels high enough to justify the high cost of green energy. Thus the cancellation of the Keystone XL pipeline and drilling rights on public lands.

title: Protest-Don't Boycott-the Beijing Olympics
summary: I hope athletes choose to make their point from the starting gate or podium.. Regarding Chen Guangcheng's "No Democracy Should Participate in the 2022 Beijing Olympics" (op-ed, Dec. 30): To forbid competition in China, a nation whose economy we avidly support through innumerable everyday purchases, seems contradictory. Like most Americans, I am sympathetic to Chinese dissidents. But in the absence of a law disallowing interaction with the People's Republic of China, Olympic athletes must decide for themselves whether to stay, go, or, as is my hope, bravely protest China's actions from the starting gate or podium.

title: IRS Employees Want Modernization
summary: The National Treasury Employees Union strongly supports efforts to upgrade the agency's computer systems.. In "The IRS Pleads Poverty" (Review & Outlook, Jan. 13), the editorial board incorrectly states the position of the union that represents Internal Revenue Service employees. The National Treasury Employees Union strongly supports efforts to modernize and upgrade the agency's computer systems, especially those that will improve efficiency and productivity. In public statements and testimony to Congress over many years, NTEU has been and continues to be a strong advocate for giving frontline IRS employees the resources they need-including staffing and technology-to improve customer service for individuals and businesses and enforce the tax code fully and fairly.

title: U.N. Report Raises Fresh Questions About Plane Diversion by Belarus
summary: Minsk didn't give ICAO team vital information to support its claim of a terrorist bomb threat against flight carrying a wanted dissident, who was arrested. A new United Nations report on the forced landing by Belarus of a Ryanair Holdings PLC passenger jet in May raises fresh questions about the veracity of statements by its government about the events, in which it arrested a wanted dissident.

title: Microsoft Will Still Need to Do Activision's Duty
summary: Opportunistic buyout of Activision is a huge bet on the future of videogame distribution-and Microsoft's cleanup abilities. Microsoft has just laid down the biggest bet ever on its own cloud business. And on its ability to clean up someone else's mess.

title: Cancel Culture Targets Charity
summary: Left-wing political activists want to destroy America's long tradition of private philanthropy.. Americans have always been free to give to nonprofit causes they believe in, but left-wing political activists are determined to limit that freedom. Considering these activists' record of successfully convincing corporations to do their bidding on a host of issues, everyone who supports the American traditions of free speech, free association and privacy should be concerned.

title: A Memo on Saving the Biden Presidency
summary: His Georgia speech was a fiasco, but he can still salvage other parts of his agenda.. Mr. President: After a year in office, your presidency is at a low ebb, and the 52nd week could hardly have gone worse. Most Americans don't see you working on the problems they care about the most-the pandemic and inflation-and what you are doing isn't working. Only 36% think your administration's fight against the coronavirus is going well. Even fewer (30%) give you a passing grade on inflation.

title: Texas Abortion Law Could Stay in Effect for Months After Ruling
summary: Appeals court holds Texas Supreme Court should weigh in on unanswered questions before challenge to law can move forward. A Texas law forbidding women from ending unwanted pregnancies after six weeks could stay in effect for at least several more months under a ruling Monday by a federal appeals court.

title: Jim Obergefell, Gay-Rights Activist, Is Running for Ohio House Seat
summary: Plaintiff in Supreme Court case that legalized same-sex marriage plans to run as Democrat and advocate for marginalized groups, strengthen economic opportunities. Jim Obergefell, the gay-rights activist who was the lead plaintiff in the 2015 U.S. Supreme Court case that legalized same-sex marriage nationwide, is running for a seat in the Ohio House of Representatives.

title: Gilead Alleges Counterfeiting Ring Sold Its HIV Drugs
summary: Gilead says HIV drugs were replaced in some cases with an antipsychotic drug or an over-the-counter painkiller. Drugmaker Gilead Sciences Inc. said that a network of little-known drug suppliers and distributors sold illicit and potentially dangerous fake versions of its HIV medicines that ended up in pharmacies and in the hands of patients.

title: Former New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio Won't Run for Governor
summary: Former mayor has polled lower than current New York Gov. Kathy Hochul. Former New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio said he won't run for governor of New York.

title: Hong Kong Orders 2,000 Hamsters to Be Killed After Pet Shop Covid-19 Cases
summary: City's Covid-zero campaign has it going to great lengths to eradicate emerging outbreaks. HONG KONG-Authorities ordered some 2,000 hamsters in Hong Kong to be killed over concerns that the animals may have transmitted Covid-19 to humans, one of the city's latest measures to try to stamp out a fresh outbreak.

title: How Johnny Carson Helped '60s TV Actress Barbara Eden Launch Her Career
summary: The 'I Dream of Jeannie' star and children's book author started out as the talk-show host's sidekick. Barbara Eden, 90, is an actress best known for her starring role in the TV sitcom "I Dream of Jeannie," from 1965 to 1970. She is the co-author of the children's book, "Barbara and the Djinn" (Neighborhood Publishers). She spoke with Marc Myers.

title: When Will EVs Go Mainstream? It Depends on Uncle Sam
summary: Electric vehicles accounted for just 4.4% of U.S. passenger-vehicle sales last year. If China and Europe are a guide, accelerating consumer adoption will require subsidies.. Without more help from Washington, electric-vehicle sales will struggle to live up to the stock-market hype.

title: Louis A. Simpson, Once Seen as Warren Buffett's Successor, Dies at Age 85
summary: Investment manager tended Geico's portfolio for decades and won high praise from his better-known boss in Omaha. Louis A. Simpson could hardly have done better in terms of endorsements: He was one of Warren Buffett's favorite fund managers.

title: For Maximum EV Efficiency, Stick to 25 Miles an Hour, Ignore Angry Drivers
summary: 'Hypermilers' in pursuit of extreme fuel efficiency in electric cars invite road rage with painfully slow driving. The Ford Mustang Mach-E electric car can hit 60 miles an hour from a standstill in 3.5 seconds. Fergal McGrath prefers to keep the needle stuck at a grandfatherly 40 mph. He's after a different kind of bragging rights.

title: Violent Crime, Rising Costs Put South Africa's Mining Industry in a Deep Hole
summary: Resume Subscription. RICHARDS BAY, South Africa-Last May, three men strode into a suburban street and sprayed gunfire into a car, killing mining executive Nico Swart on his way to work.

title: Chamath Palihapitiya Responds to Criticism Over Uyghur Comments
summary: Billionaire said nobody cares about treatment of minority group in Xinjiang region. Chamath Palihapitiya, the billionaire investor and minority owner of the NBA's Golden State Warriors, responded to criticism over comments he made on his podcast in which he said that nobody cares about China's treatment of the Uyghur minority group.

title: Activision, Apple, Tesla, Goldman Sachs: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Activision Blizzard shares soared on a deal with Microsoft; Goldman Sachs reported a profit drop. Wall Street stock indexes dropped in morning trading, with tech stocks leading losses. Government bond yields are climbing as investors position themselves for a higher interest-rate future. Here's what we're watching Tuesday:

title: Kazakhstan's Former President Breaks Silence Over Unrest, Backs Successor
summary: Nursultan Nazarbayev says he remained in country throughout recent violence, denies rift among elite. MOSCOW-Kazakhstan's former president, who was conspicuously silent during several days of turmoil that recently engulfed the Central Asian nation, denied in an address to the nation on Tuesday that he had been embroiled in political infighting and expressed full confidence in his chosen successor.

title: The Lumineers Song 'Where We Are' Is a Story of Survival

title: Texas Hostage Taker Was Known to U.K. Intelligence
summary: British authorities investigated U.K. national who took four people hostage in Texas, but determined he wasn't a sufficient threat to track further. LONDON-The British man who took four people hostage at a synagogue in Texas had previously been investigated by the U.K.'s domestic intelligence service, according to a British security official familiar with the matter.

title: Cincinnati Agency Buys Nearly 200 Rental Homes, Thwarting Investors
summary: Resume Subscription. A Cincinnati government entity outbid more than a dozen investment firms to buy 194 homes in and around the city, a move meant to keep tenants in their homes and private investors out of their neighborhoods.

title: Who Will Be 'Jeopardy!' Host? Who Cares? The Show Is Having a Great Season
summary: The game show is back on top, thanks to Amy Schneider's winning streak, more sports-style analytics and a new executive producer rallying fans. "Jeopardy!" hit disaster last year when its host search turned into a sideshow. There is still no permanent host, but the game show is on a hot streak in its 38th season.

title: Blackstone Property Fund Targeting Small Investors Passes $50 Billion
summary: Fund known as BREIT has scooped up rental-apartment buildings, warehouses, office buildings. The largest fund administered by Blackstone Group Inc., the giant investment firm known for raising capital from institutions such as pension funds and endowments, is now one that mostly targets individual investors.

title: The Baseball Hall of Fame's New-Member Slump
summary: The annual election by baseball writers is leading to few new inductions as voters squabble over performance-enhancing drugs and 'character issues'. When Josh Rawitch became president of the National Baseball Hall of Fame in September, longtime museum librarian Jim Gates offered him a welcome present: a copy of a New York Times story criticizing the process for deciding who gains admittance to Cooperstown.

title: Sudan Protesters Begin Strike as Conflict With Generals Worsens
summary: Walkout comes as economic crisis adds to unrest from last year's coup. Pro-democracy groups began two days of strikes and civil disobedience in Sudan on Tuesday, a day after security forces fired live rounds and used tear gas to disperse protesters in some of the deadliest clashes since a military coup last year.

title: Some Lawmakers Push to Ban Stock Trading by Colleagues
summary: Proponents cite sensitive information and possible conflicts, while critics point to costs and existing laws. WASHINGTON-Federal judges and central bank officials have faced stepped-up scrutiny over stock trades, due to concerns about possible conflicts of interest or access to nonpublic information. Now, the spotlight is turning to Congress.

title: Israel Struggles to Get Its Kids Inoculated
summary: About a quarter of Israeli children between 5 and 11 years old have got their first shot, despite an aggressive government campaign. TEL AVIV-Israeli adults were among the first in the world to roll up their sleeves for a Covid-19 vaccine. But many of them are now pushing back against the government's aggressive campaign to inoculate their young children, despite the Omicron risk.

title: Chinese Investment in U.S. Plane Maker Draws FBI, National-Security Reviews
summary: The scrutiny on Icon Aircraft comes as Washington and Beijing vie to control technologies seen as critical for future competitiveness. The FBI and a U.S. investment-screening panel are investigating a Chinese investment in an aircraft startup following allegations of improper technology transfer to China, according to people familiar with the matter and documents reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: Texas, Arizona Have Recovered All the Jobs Lost When Covid-19 Hit
summary: The two states along with Idaho and Utah ascended from pandemic depths, thanks to population growth, shifts by businesses and workers away from coastal urban areas. Texas and Arizona have joined two other states in recovering all the jobs they lost at the start of the Covid-19 pandemic, leading a trend that is expected to include another dozen states by the middle of this year.

title: Offices Are Leased Up, Thanks to Cash Gifts for Tenants, Months of Free Rent
summary: Recovery of U.S. office rents owes much of its success to freebies, other incentives offered by landlords. The recent recovery of U.S. office rents owes much of its success to something landlords hate to discuss: all the freebies, cash gifts and other incentives they have to fork over to tenants.

title: Big U.S. Companies Step Up Hiring of Female, Black CFOs
summary: These executives continue to comprise a small portion of officers overseeing the finances of America's biggest businesses, but their ranks are growing, and the trend is expected to continue. America's biggest businesses employed more female and Black finance chiefs in 2021 than ever before-albeit coming from a relatively low base-as company leaders and boards are under pressure to broaden their C-suite, a trend recruiters expect will accelerate in 2022.

title: In Battle for Workers, the Humble 401(k) Gets Richer in 2022
summary: Facebook, KPMG among companies sweetening retirement plan contributions this year in tight job market. Facebook 's parent and consulting firm KPMG U.S. are among a growing number of companies putting more money into employees' 401(k) retirement accounts, employing another lever to attract and retain staff amid high turnover and competition for talent.

title: Taliban Intensify Efforts to Take Control of Overseas Embassies
summary: Resume Subscription. ROME-Five months after the Taliban seized Kabul, Afghanistan's new rulers are stepping up their campaign to gain control of the country's embassies abroad, most of which continue to be run by diplomats appointed by the former, U.S.-backed government.

title: Kim Jong Un's January Missile-Test Barrage Is Fast but Not Furious
summary: North Korea's spree of weapons launches carries strategic purpose, both in defense and diplomacy, security experts say. SEOUL-North Korea has never started a year with so many weapons tests. Kim Jong Un has many reasons to be in a hurry.

title: Macau Needs Visitors, Not Just a Milder Gambling Law
summary: A new gambling law looks likely to be much less punishing than expected and is pushing up stocks. But that isn't the casino industry's biggest problem.. Macau stocks have been on a losing streak for two years. Investors are hoping to finally turn the tables: Proposed changes to the city's gambling laws appear to be much milder than expected. But ultimately the gambling hub's fortunes-and those of its casinos-depend on the large-scale return of Chinese travelers. That could be a while yet.

title: Schumer Hits Trouble After Earlier Wins in 50-50 Senate
summary: Senate majority leader pushes ahead with votes on election legislation despite likely failure. WASHINGTON-Last month, the Democratic-controlled Senate failed to advance President Biden's roughly $2 trillion economic plan. This week, the party's push to overhaul election practices nationwide is set to fizzle out as well.

title: Tonga Volcano Set Off Waves in the Air-Then Rare Tsunamis
summary: The 4-foot water waves that reached California were likely triggered by pressure waves in atmosphere, scientists say. TOKYO-The tsunamis that reached California and Japan after Tonga's volcanic eruptions were likely caused by powerful air-pressure waves, possibly the first such occurrence since the 1883 Krakatau eruption, scientists said.

title: Citigroup Nears Sale of Taiwan Consumer-Banking Business
summary: Final details of the deal with Singapore-based DBS are under deliberation, and the transaction is likely to be valued at $1.8 billion to $2.2 billion. HONG KONG- Citigroup Inc. is nearing a sale of its retail banking franchise in Taiwan to DBS Group Holdings Ltd. for around $2 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter, as the New York-based bank speeds up its strategic shift in Asia.

title: As Employers Scramble to Fill Jobs, Workers Relish a Feeling of Power
summary: With plenty of companies hiring, workers are quitting their jobs in droves and starting their own ventures. 'I refuse to accept a position that's just a position.'. Raises, signing bonuses, more flexibility. Amid a historically tight labor market, more workers are feeling their power-and flexing it.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: BlackRock's Climate Stance Is About Profits, Not Politics, Fink Says
summary: In his annual letter, the money manager's chief makes the capitalist case for pushing companies on hot-button issues. Larry Fink's efforts to get companies to adopt climate-friendly policies have led some to call him an activist. The BlackRock Inc. chairman and chief executive prefers a different label: capitalist.

title: U.S. Airlines Seek Further 5G Rollout Delay
summary: Carriers say deployment near airports under current FAA restrictions could ground significant portion of their fleets; cellular companies have disputed flight-safety risks. The chief executives of major passenger and cargo airlines said there could be significant flight disruptions when new 5G service goes live in the U.S. this week, unless implementation of the wireless service within 2 miles of major airport runways is delayed.

title: Macellum Urges Kohl's to Make Changes or Explore Sale
summary: Activist with roughly 5% stake has been in talks with retailer and believes it has suitors. An activist investor is renewing a push to get department-store chain Kohl's Inc. to take action to boost its lagging stock.

title: Winter Storm Strikes Eastern U.S., Causing Power Outages and Flight Cancellations
summary: As much as 20 inches of snow falls in parts of Ohio, Pennsylvania, North Carolina and South Carolina; forecasts warn of potential white-out conditions. After punishing parts of the South with ice and snow over the weekend, a winter storm hit the mid-Atlantic and northeastern U.S., causing widespread travel disruptions and knocking out power by Monday morning for more than 200,000 homes and businesses.

title: Martin Luther King Jr.'s Family Marks Holiday With Voting-Rights March
summary: Resume Subscription. The nation's capital marked Martin Luther King Jr. Day with a march for voting rights led by the late civil-rights leader's family, as congressional Democrats vowed to press ahead on voting-rights legislation despite its expected failure.
